properties.areaDesc: Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 8 at 12:59PM PST until January 9 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...No significant changes.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches
with 2 to 5 inches closer to Lassen National Park and Cedar
Pass.

* WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties and
Surprise Valley California including Susanville, Portola, and
Cedarville.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Thursday. Most of
the snow should fall between midnight and 6 AM Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute. Expect chain
controls and delays going over Sierra passes such as Fredonyer
and north of Susanville on Highway 395.
properties.instruction:
Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during
periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to
reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since
it takes longer to stop on slick roadways.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY
